newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Nigeria releases $145.8 mln to state oil company.
newsitem.headline: Nigeria releases $145.8 mln to state oil company.

text.p: Nigeria's finance ministry has released $145.833 million to state-run oil company (NNPC) for its priority projects, including rehabilitating the country's ailing four refineries, a local newspaper reported on Wednesday.
The independent Vanguard said oil minister Dan Etete had ordered that the shut northern Kaduna refinery be allocated $40 million from the grant for repairs.
Kaduna, with an installed capacity of 110 barrels per day (bpd), was shut down last week due to faults in its cooling unit.

Lack of maintenance and funds to purchase spare parts have made Nigeria's refineries, with a combined capacity of 445,000 bpd, produce about one-third of their total output. Fuel shortages are common in Africa's largest oil-producing nation which pumps over two million bpd.
State-run News Agency of Nigeria said on Monday that the finance ministry had released 32.8 naira ($397.6 million) from the 89 billion naira ($1,072 million) budgeted for capital projects in 1997.
